page.title: 05HEATHFIELD NURSERY, TABLEY
page.content: THREE MEN WORK AT THIS NURSERY.ONE IS A RESIDENT NEARBY AND LIVES IN A CARAVAN.THE OTHER TWO LIVE WITH THEIR FAMILIES.THE MAN THAT LIVES IN A CARAVAN HAS BEEN THERE FOR TWENTY YEARS AND DOING HIS JOB FOR EIGHTEEN YEARS. THE NURSERY COVERS HALF AN ACRE AND HAS NINE GREENHOUSES AND TWENTY-ONE BAYS.THERE ARE ABOUT FORTY MAIN SORTS OF PLANTS AND THE MOST POPULAR ARE AGERATUM,ALYSSUM AND PETUNIA.{ { }THE NURSERY HAS ABOUT SIXTY CUSTOMERS A DAY IN THE BEDDING SEASON.THE BEDDING SEASON IS BETWEEN APRIL AND JUNE.DURING THIS TIME ALL THREE MEN GET UP AT ABOUT FOUR O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING AND FINISH WORKING AT ABOUT NINE O'CLOCK AT NIGHT. WHITE,BLACK AND GREEN-FLY ARE THE BIGGEST NUISANCE IN THE NURSERY.
